title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6215.5 - Filing of petitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6215.5 - Filing of petitions

State Regulations
(a) Neither the application for, nor the
issuance of, an identification number constitutes filing of a
petition. (b) Petitions shall be
filed with the applicable Board of Elections as set forth in the Election Law. The officer or board shall endorse the day, hour and minute of receipt on such
petitions. Such officer or board shall keep a book, which shall be open to
public inspection, in which shall be entered the name of the candidate, and
volume or identification numbers of the petitions which have been filed and the
time of their filing. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
6215.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
